poem:
**The Art of Denial**

Amidst the ink and scrutiny,  
a titan bids to shield his name—  
lewd letters and sketches,  
each stroke a phantom traced in pulp.  
In the world of paper giants,  
ten billion drafts demand their due;  
yet truth, like shadows,  
slips through solemn grasp,  
as echoes of silence  
rumble in their gilded halls.
